required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir in Adults With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus Infection Who Are on Dialysis for End Stage Renal Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir for 12 Weeks in Subjects With Chronic HCV Infection Who Are on Dialysis for End Stage Renal Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objectives of this study are to evaluate safety, efficacy, and tolerability of treatment with sofosbuvir/velpatasvir (SOF/VEL) for 12 weeks in adults on dialysis for end stage renal disease (ESRD) with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection of any genotype.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response 12 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR12)
primary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as HCV RNA < the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ; ie, 15 IU/mL) 12 weeks after stopping the study treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Permanently Discontinued the Study Drug Due to an Adverse Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: First dose date up to Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response 4 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR4)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR4 was defined as HCV RNA < LLOQ 4 weeks after stopping study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response 24 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR24)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR24 was defined as HCV RNA < LLOQ 24 weeks after stopping study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HCV RNA
Percentage of Participants With HCV RNA < LLOQ on Treatment
Percentage of Participants With Virologic Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic failure was defined as: On-treatment virologic failure: Breakthrough (confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ after having previously had HCV RNA < LLOQ while on treatment), or Rebound (confirmed > 1 log10 IU/mL increase in HCV RNA from nadir while on treatment), or Non-response (HCV RNA persistently ≥ LLOQ through 8 weeks of treatment) Virologic relapse: Confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ during the posttreatment period having achieved HCV RNA < LLOQ at last on-treatment visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Develop Viral Resistance (as Assessed by Presence of HCV NS5A and NS5B Genes) to SOF and VEL During Treatment and After Discontinuation of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose date up to Posttreatment Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline deep sequencing of the HCV NS5A and NS5B genes was performed for all participants. For all participants with virologic failure, deep sequencing was performed at the first time point after virologic failure if the plasma or serum sample was available and HCV RNA was > 1000 IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sparse PK samples at Weeks 6, 8, and 12 (all participants). Intensive PK samples at predose, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours postdose once at Week 6, 8, or 12 (participants who enrolled in the optional PK substudy (N=1))
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau is defined as the population PK derived area under the concentration versus time curve of the drug over the dosing interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameter: AUCtau of GS-331007 (Metabolite of SOF)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sparse PK samples at Weeks 6, 8, and 12 (all participants). Intensive PK samples at predose, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours postdose once at Week 6, 8, or 12 (participants who enrolled in the optional PK substudy (N=1))
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau is defined as the population PK derived area under the concentration versus time curve of the drug over the dosing interval.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sparse PK samples at Weeks 6, 8, and 12 (all participants). Intensive PK samples at predose, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours postdose once at Week 6, 8, or 12 (participants who enrolled in the optional PK substudy (N=1))
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau is defined as the population PK derived area under the concentration verses time curve of the drug over the dosing interval.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sparse PK samples at Weeks 6, 8, and 12 (all participants). Intensive PK samples at predose, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours postdose once at Week 6, 8, or 12 (participants who enrolled in the optional PK substudy (N=1))
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as the population PK derived maximum concentration of the drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameter: Cmax of GS-331007 (Metabolite of SOF)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sparse PK samples at Weeks 6, 8, and 12 (all participants). Intensive PK samples at predose, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours postdose once at Week 6, 8, or 12 (participants who enrolled in the optional PK substudy (N=1))
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as the population PK derived maximum concentration of the drug.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sparse PK samples at Weeks 6, 8, and 12 (all participants). Intensive PK samples at predose, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours postdose once at Week 6, 8, or 12 (participants who enrolled in the optional PK substudy (N=1))
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as the population PK derived maximum concentration of the drug.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sparse PK samples at Weeks 6, 8, and 12 (all participants). Intensive PK samples at predose, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours postdose once at Week 6, 8, or 12 (participants who enrolled in the optional PK substudy (N=1))
secondary_outcome.description: Ctau is defined as the population PK derived concentration of the drug at the end of a 24 hour dosing interval. The 24 hour Ctau is estimated based on the combination of sparse PK samples collected at random times across the dosing interval as well as intensive PK samples collected for up to 12 hours post-dose.

intervention.description: 400/100 mg fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet(s) administered orally once daily

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic HCV infected, male and non-pregnant/non-lactating females aged 18 years or older who are on dialysis for ESRD, including adults with HIV co-infection if they are suppressed on a stable, protocol-approved antiretroviral (ARV) regimen for ≥8 weeks prior to screening.
NOTE: Other protocol defined Inclusion/ Exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: Gordon and Leslie Diamond Health Care Center, Vancouver General Hospital, UBC Division of Gastroenterology
William Osler Health System- Brampton Civic Hospital
Hamilton Health Sciences - McMaster University Medical Centre Site
Centre de Recherche du Centre Hospitalier de l'Universite de Montreal (CRCHUM)
Hospital Universitario Puerta de Hierro - Majadahonda

results_reference.citation: Borgia SM, Dearden J, Lurie Y, Shafran SD, Brown A, Hyland RH, et al. Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir for 12 Weeks Is Safe and Effective in Patients Undergoing Dialysis. American Association for the Study of Liver Diseases (AASLD); 2018 09-13 November; San Francisco, CA.

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified external researchers may request IPD for this study after study completion. For more information, please visit our website at https://www.gilead.com/science-and-medicine/research/clinical-trials-transparency-and-data-sharing-policy.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A secured external environment with username, password, and RSA code.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled at study sites in Canada, the United Kingdom, Spain, Israel, New Zealand, and Australia. The first participant was screened on 22 March 2017. The last study visit occurred on 07 November 2018.

group.title: SOF/VEL
group.description: Sofosbuvir/velpatasvir (SOF/VEL) (400/100 mg) fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks

baseline.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: SOF/VEL (GT-1)
group.description: SOF/VEL (400/100 mg) FDC tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks in participants with genotype 1 (GT-1) HCV infection

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: IL28b Status
measure.description: The CC, CT, and TT alleles are different forms of the IL28b gene.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response 12 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR12)
outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as HCV RNA < the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ; ie, 15 IU/mL) 12 weeks after stopping the study treatment.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set included participants who are enrolled into the study and received at least 1 dose of study drug.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Failure
measure.description: Virologic failure was defined as: On-treatment virologic failure: Breakthrough (confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ after having previously had HCV RNA < LLOQ while on treatment), or Rebound (confirmed > 1 log10 IU/mL increase in HCV RNA from nadir while on treatment), or Non-response (HCV RNA persistently ≥ LLOQ through 8 weeks of treatment) Virologic relapse: Confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ during the posttreatment period having achieved HCV RNA < LLOQ at last on-treatment visit
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set were analyzed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Develop Viral Resistance (as Assessed by Presence of HCV NS5A and NS5B Genes) to SOF and VEL During Treatment and After Discontinuation of Treatment
outcome.description: Baseline deep sequencing of the HCV NS5A and NS5B genes was performed for all participants. For all participants with virologic failure, deep sequencing was performed at the first time point after virologic failure if the plasma or serum sample was available and HCV RNA was > 1000 IU/mL.
outcome.time_frame: First dose date up to Posttreatment Week 24
outcome.population: Participants in the Resistance Analysis Population Set included all participants in the Safety Analysis Set with a virologic outcome and at least 1 gene sequenced. All data are reported at a 15% assay cutoff.

group.title: SOF/VEL
group.description: SOF/VEL (400/100 mg) FDC tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Develop Viral Resistance (as Assessed by Presence of HCV NS5A and NS5B Genes) to SOF and VEL During Treatment and After Discontinuation of Treatment
measure.description: Baseline deep sequencing of the HCV NS5A and NS5B genes was performed for all participants. For all participants with virologic failure, deep sequencing was performed at the first time point after virologic failure if the plasma or serum sample was available and HCV RNA was > 1000 IU/mL.
measure.population: Participants in the Resistance Analysis Population Set included all participants in the Safety Analysis Set with a virologic outcome and at least 1 gene sequenced. All data are reported at a 15% assay cutoff.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: AUCtau of SOF
outcome.description: AUCtau is defined as the population PK derived area under the concentration versus time curve of the drug over the dosing interval.
outcome.time_frame: Sparse PK samples at Weeks 6, 8, and 12 (all participants). Intensive PK samples at predose, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours postdose once at Week 6, 8, or 12 (participants who enrolled in the optional PK substudy (N=1))
outcome.population: Participants in the PK Analysis Set (all participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 nonmissing postdose concentration value for the corresponding analyte in plasma) with available data were analyzed. Population PK analyses of all sparse and intensive PK data were utilized to estimate steady-state AUCtau of SOF.

group.title: SOF/VEL
group.description: SOF/VEL (400/100 mg) FDC tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks

measure.title: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: AUCtau of SOF
measure.description: AUCtau is defined as the population PK derived area under the concentration versus time curve of the drug over the dosing interval.
measure.population: Participants in the PK Analysis Set (all participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 nonmissing postdose concentration value for the corresponding analyte in plasma) with available data were analyzed. Population PK analyses of all sparse and intensive PK data were utilized to estimate steady-state AUCtau of SOF.

outcome.population: Participants in the PK analysis Set were analyzed. Population PK analyses of all sparse and intensive PK data were utilized to estimate steady-state AUCtau of GS-331007 .

The 24 hour Ctau is estimated based on the combination of sparse PK samples collected at random times across the dosing interval as well as intensive PK samples collected for up to 12 hours post-dose.
outcome.time_frame: Sparse PK samples at Weeks 6, 8, and 12 (all participants). Intensive PK samples at predose, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours postdose once at Week 6, 8, or 12 (participants who enrolled in the optional PK substudy (N=1))
outcome.population: Participants in the PK Analysis Set were analyzed. Population PK analyses of all sparse and intensive PK data were utilized to estimate steady-state Ctau of VEL.

group.title: SOF/VEL
group.description: SOF/VEL (400/100 mg) FDC tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks

measure.title: PK Parameter: Ctau of VEL
measure.description: Ctau is defined as the population PK derived concentration of the drug at the end of a 24 hour dosing interval. The 24 hour Ctau is estimated based on the combination of sparse PK samples collected at random times across the dosing interval as well as intensive PK samples collected for up to 12 hours post-dose.
measure.population: Participants in the PK Analysis Set were analyzed. Population PK analyses of all sparse and intensive PK data were utilized to estimate steady-state Ctau of VEL.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events: First dose date up to Week 12 plus 30 days; All-Cause Mortality: First dose date up to Posttreatment Week 24
reported_events.desc: The Safety Analysis Set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: SOF/VEL
group.description: SOF/VEL (400/100 mg) FDC tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: After conclusion of the study and without prior written approval from Gilead, investigators in this study may communicate, orally present, or publish in scientific journals or other media only after the following conditions have been met: The results of the study in their entirety have been publicly disclosed by or with the consent of Gilead in an abstract, manuscript, or presentation form; or The study has been completed at all study sites for at least 2 years
